meanings.definition: A person or thing that carries or holds something.
meanings.sent1: The bearer of the heavy box struggled to lift it.
meanings.sent2: The courier acted as the bearer of important documents.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel became the bearer of acorns for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed like a bearer of life through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The backpack served as the bearer of all my school supplies.

meanings.definition: A person who presents or brings something.
meanings.sent1: The bearer of gifts arrived at the party.
meanings.sent2: The hostess thanked the bearer of the delicious cake.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit was the bearer of surprises.
meanings.sent4: The sun was the bearer of warmth on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The messenger acted as the bearer of important news.

meanings.definition: A person who supports or sustains something.
meanings.sent1: The strong pillar was the bearer of the heavy roof.
meanings.sent2: The loyal friend was the bearer of emotional support.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was the bearer of his powers.
meanings.sent4: The tree stood tall as the bearer of shade in the park.
meanings.sent5: The foundation acted as the bearer of the entire building.
